ptolemy.backtrack.eclipse.ast.transform

Interface ConstructorHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConstructorTransformer

    public interface ConstructorHandler
    Interface of the constructor handlers called by TypeAnalyzer. Users may register constructor handlers (and other kinds of supported handlers) to the TypeAnalyzer used to analyze Java source code. When the analyzer detects a constructor declaration or a call to a constructor, it calls back those constructor handlers after proper types are assigned to all the arguments.

    Constructor handlers are allowed to modify the constructor, either by modifying its children in the AST, or by replacing the whole constructor with another valid AST node. This is because the handler is called after the subtree rooted at the constructor is completely visited by the analyzer. However, modifying any node out of this subtree (e.g., changing the parent of this constructor to another one) may cause unexpected effect.

    Since:
    Ptolemy II 5.1
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Thomas Feng
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (tfeng)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (tfeng)

      • handle

        void handle(org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.MethodDeclaration node,
            TypeAnalyzerState state)
        Handle a method declaration node that corresponds to a constructor. The type analyzer calls back this method when it reaches a constructor. In an Eclipse AST, a constructor is defined with a MethodDeclaration as other methods, but its isConstructor method returns true.
        Parameters:
        node - The constructor node.
        state - The current state of the type analyzer.

      • handle

        Parameters:

        state - The current state of the type analyzer.
